item.title: Officers conduct naming ceremony for two abandoned infants in Raichur
item.description:
<![CDATA[Officers conducted a naming ceremony for two abandoned infants at the Child Adoption Centre in Raichur.
In an emotional gesture, the two abandoned babies were named by the officials of the District Child Protection Unit, District Child Welfare Committee, and Government Childcare Institution on November 6 in Raichur.
These two babies – one male and one female – were rescued by the officers and were protected at the Government Adoption Centre. The male baby was found abandoned near Kalmala villa...]]>
item.author: Authors

item.title: Raichur DC directs officials to ensure compensation for SC and ST victims of atrocities
item.description:
<![CDATA[Raichur Deputy Commissioner Nitish K. has told officials to take action to release compensation to family members of victims of atrocity, as the majority of them don’t even know that they are entitled to compensation according to the rules of the government of Karnataka.
Chairing the District Level Awareness and Monitoring Committee for Control of Atrocities against Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in Raichur on October 4, the DC said that the family members of victims who belong to the SC...]]>
